intro: Synnotia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered synnotia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Synnotia parviflora is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
